The 'Oracle Database' (commonly referred to as 'Oracle RDBMS' or simply as
'Oracle') is an object-relational database management system 
produced and marketed by Oracle Corporation.

Larry Ellison and his friends, former co-workers Bob Miner and Ed Oates, started
the consultancy Software Development Laboratories (SDL) in 1977. SDL developed
the original version of the Oracle software. The name Oracle comes from the code-
name of a CIA-funded project Ellison had worked on while previously employed by
Ampex.
